      • addFutureMeeting

        public int addFutureMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                            java.util.Calendar date)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Add a new meeting to be held in the future. An ID is returned when the meeting is put into the system. This ID must be positive and non-zero.
        Specified by:
        addFutureMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of contacts that will participate in the meeting
        date - the date on which the meeting will take place
        Returns:
        the ID for the meeting
        See Also:
        ContactManager.addFutureMeeting(Set, Calendar)

      • getPastMeeting

        public PastMeeting getPastMeeting(int id)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Returns the PAST meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none. The meeting must have happened at a past date.
        Specified by:
        getPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        id - the ID for the meeting
        Returns:
        the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.
        See Also:

      • getFutureMeetingList

        public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Returns the list of future meetings scheduled with this contact. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.
        Specified by:
        getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the users contacts
        Returns:
        the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
        See Also:
        ContactManager.getFutureMeetingList(Contact)

      • getMeetingListOn

        public java.util.List<Meeting> getMeetingListOn(java.util.Calendar date)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Returns the list of meetings that are scheduled for, or that took place on, the specified date If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.
        Specified by:
        getMeetingListOn in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        date - the date
        Returns:
        the list of meetings
        See Also:
        ContactManager.getMeetingListOn(Calendar)

      • getPastMeetingListFor

        public java.util.List<PastMeeting> getPastMeetingListFor(Contact contact)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Returns the list of past meetings in which this contact has participated. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.
        Specified by:
        getPastMeetingListFor in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the users contacts
        Returns:
        the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
        See Also:
        ContactManager.getPastMeetingListFor(Contact)

        public void addNewPastMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                              java.util.Calendar date,
                              java.lang.String text)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Create a new record for a meeting that took place in the past.
        Specified by:
        addNewPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of participants
        date - the date on which the meeting took place
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.
        See Also:
        ContactManager.addNewPastMeeting(Set, Calendar, String)

      • addMeetingNotes

        public PastMeeting addMeetingNotes(int id,
                                   java.lang.String text)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Add notes to a meeting. This method is used when a future meeting takes place, and is then converted to a past meeting (with notes) and returned. It can be also used to add notes to a past meeting at a later date.
        Specified by:
        addMeetingNotes in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the meeting
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.
        See Also:
        ContactManager.addMeetingNotes(int, String)

        Description copied from interface: ContactManager

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        notes - notes to be added about the contact.
        Returns:
        the ID for the new contact
        See Also:

      • getContacts

        public java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Returns a list with the contacts whose name contains that string. If the string is the empty string, this methods returns the set that contains all current contacts.
        Specified by:
        getContacts in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        name - the string to search for
        Returns:
        a list with the contacts whose name contains that string.
        See Also:
        ContactManager.getContacts(String)

      • getContacts

        public java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(int... ids)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Returns a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs. Note that this method can be used to retrieve just one contact by passing only one ID.
        Specified by:
        getContacts in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        ids - an arbitrary number of contact IDs
        Returns:
        a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs.
        See Also:
        ContactManager.getContacts(int...)

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Save all data to disk. This method must be executed when the program is closed and when/if the user requests it.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface ContactManager
        See Also:
        ContactManager.flush()
